instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message: hello guys , the machine am currently using is having where I can not assess the internal drive , although I can erase it and mount it , but when I try to install MacOs , the machine would restart , however  I am currently using the machine through an external drive . I tried to install Linux but could not go through either , meanwhile, I can successfully install macOS on an external drive , I am not familiar with an issue like this one , please help guys

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message: From USB macOS, see if you can write and read files on internal SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message: When I try to read or write to it , the machine would restart

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message:
Open up terminal and at the prompt type:
diskutil eraseDisk JHFS+ SSD disk0
Let see if this helps...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message:
Another trick from dukefawks collection:
Boot from wifi, hold shift+command+alt+R and turn on machine.
It should boot to the installer from the original OS that was shipped with the machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message: When I initiate the above process the internal drive do not appear , only Apple disk image Media and OS X Base System, so I canâ€™t install

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message: Did you really boot from wireless???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message: yes I did , just as you instructed, the original macOS was Sierra , but no internal drive found , so could not continue

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message: Can you still erase and mount it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message: Can do that with Disk Utility from installer pendrive, or only from preinstalled USB macOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message: I can do it from both

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message: So you can format internal SSD from installer, but it doesn't recognize it when go ahead with the installation?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message: I can see the drive too during the installer stage, but when I when through with the WIFI option , I didn't see the drive . Also , with the pen drive installer , once the drive has been formatted and I try to install to it , it would freeze and restart, I wish I can show you a video, but I don't know what medium to use for that

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal drive issues
threads.message:
No video needed.
You may have problems with some NAND chip.
